events.event_name: Mexico November 2025 Gross Fixed Investment Release
events.description: The release of Mexico's gross fixed investment data for November 2025, showing a continued slump.

facts.fact_text: Mexico’s gross fixed investment fell 6.4% year on year in November 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Mexico’s gross fixed investment fell 6.4% year on year in November 2025

facts.fact_text: Investment in machinery and equipment decreased by 14.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: Spending on machinery and equipment plunged 14.5%

facts.fact_text: Construction activity rose by 1.3% in November.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, construction rose 1.3%, rebounding from a 0.6% contraction in October

facts.fact_text: Residential activity increased by 10.3% while non-residential building fell by 6.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: as a 10.3% surge in residential activity offset a 6.5% fall in non-residential building

claims.claim_text: The 6.4% decline in fixed investment was worse than market expectations.
The month-on-month investment growth showed a deceleration in momentum.

evidences.evidence_text: investment edged up 0.4% month on month, slowing from October’s 0.9% gain

evidence.evidence_text: Mexico’s gross fixed investment fell 6.4% year on year in November 2025... marking the 15th straight month of contraction.
Spending on machinery and equipment plunged 14.5%, led by a 19.5% fall in both domestic and imported transport equipment.
as a 10.3% surge in residential activity offset a 6.5% fall in non-residential building
